intro: Epicampes pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
